description: At least 18,500 people have sought refuge across the border amid violence between militants and security forces in Myanmar.
title: Violence in Myanmar Pushes at Least 18,500 Rohingya Into Bangladesh
title_page: Violence in Myanmar Pushes at Least 18,500 Rohingya Into Bangladesh - The New York Times
text:
The number of Rohingya, a predominantly Muslim ethnic group, who have fled from Myanmar to Bangladesh since border clashes erupted five days ago has reached at least 18,500, the United Nationsâ€™ International Office of Migration said on Wednesday.
Thousands more are unable to cross the border, according to the migration office, or have found temporary shelter in Sittwe, the capital of the restive state of Rakhine in western Myanmar.
Most of those making the journey are women, children and elderly people.
